Reddy wrote a while back:
> -- A Do's and Don'ts Readme is written and checked into the docs 
> directory of the ArchiveOpenCrawler module. This talks about the
> notions to be adhered while using this module.

Reviewing this document ("CVSInstructions.txt"), I don't 
fully agree with putting everything in a single CVS
module. 

In particular, I still want to use a separate module --
currently called 'Design' but to be renamed 'Project' --
to capture high-level project documents and proposals
in progress. These are largely separable from the full
build environment, and perhaps of interest to a larger
audience. 

Developer documentation of what written (or soon to be 
written) code actually does, and basic user documentation for
the sake of launching/configuring the crawler, still
belongs in the /docs/ directory of the main module. 

Also, while I initially thought including all 3rd-party 
libraries inside the project in both their distro form
and usable form was a very good idea, I see that it runs
afould of SourceForge's recommendations, which frown
upon the use of CVS to store large/unchanging materials. 
It's also leading to a lot of redundant copies of libraries
when I'm working with both our several modules and perhaps 
even the home modules of the libraries in question.

For now, I think we can continue this practice of
"include it all", but we may need to revisit this eventually.

- Gordon
